javaslang

Class Strings

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaslang.Strings

  • public final class Strings
extends Object

    Extension methods for String.

    This class is not intended to be extended.

      • repeat

        public static String repeat(String s,
                            int n)
        Duplicate a string n times.
        Parameters:
        s - A String
        n - Duplication count, may be negative or zero.
        Returns:
        A string, s duplicated n times or null, if s is null. If n is negative or zero, the empty string is returned.

      • repeat

        public static String repeat(char c,
                            int n)
        Duplicates a char n times.
        Parameters:
        c - A char.
        n - A count of spaces, may be negative or zero.
        Returns:
        A string, c duplicated n times. If n is negative or zero, the empty string is returned.

        Returns:
        Escaped string or null if s is null.

      • escape

        public static String escape(String s,
                            char character,
                            char escape)
        Escapes occurrences of character within s with the given escape character. The escape character is also escaped.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to be escaped.
        character - The character to be escaped.
        escape - The escape character.
        Returns:
        The escaped String.

      • lineAndColumn

        public static Tuple.Tuple2<Integer,Integer> lineAndColumn(String s,
                                                          int index)

        Computes line and column of index within a given text.

        Line breaks:
        • \r\n (Windows, DOS, OS/2, CP/M, TOS (Atari))
        • \n (Unix, Linux, Android, Mac OS X, AmigaOS, BSD, etc.)
        • \r ((Mac OS up to Version 9, Apple II, C64))
        Examples:
        • lineAndColumn(null, 0) throws 's is null'
        • lineAndColumn(emptyDocument, 0) = (1,1)
        • lineAndColumn("text", 0) = (1,1)
        • lineAndColumn("text", 1) = (1,2)
        • lineAndColumn("text", "text".length()) = (1,5)
        • lineAndColumn("lorem\nipsum", "lorem\nipsum".indexOf('\n')) = (1,6)
        • lineAndColumn("lorem\nipsum", "lorem\nipsum".indexOf('\n') + 1) = (2,1)
        Parameters:
        s - input
        index - <= s.length
        Returns:
        new int[] line, column

      • isNullOrEmpty

        public static boolean isNullOrEmpty(String s)
        Tests if given String is null or empty.
        Parameters:
        s - A String
        Returns:
        true, if s is null or empty, false otherwise

      • join

        public static String join(String[] strings,
                          char separator,
                          char escape)
        Concatenates the given strings using the given separator character. Occurrences of escape or separator within a string are escaped with the given escape character. Shortcut for Stream.of(strings).map(s -> Strings.escape(s, separator, escape)).collect(Collectors.joining(String.valueOf(separator))) .
        Parameters:
        strings - An array of Strings, not null.
        separator - A separator character.
        escape - An escape character.
        Returns:
        The concatenation of the escaped strings using the given separator and escape character.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If separator equals escape.
        NullPointerException - If strings is null.

      • join

        public static String join(Iterable<String> strings,
                          char separator,
                          char escape)
        Concatenates a given Iterable of strings using the given separator character. Occurrences of escape or separator within a string are escaped with the given escape character. Shortcut for Streamz.stream(strings).map(s -> Strings.escape(s, separator, escape)).collect(Collectors.joining(String.valueOf(separator))) .
        Parameters:
        strings - An Iterable of Strings, not null.
        separator - A separator character.
        escape - An escape character.
        Returns:
        The concatenation of the escaped strings using the given separator and escape character.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If separator equals escape.
        NullPointerException - If strings is null.

      • split

        public static String[] split(String string,
                             String separator)

        Splits a string using a specific separator. By definition, a separator separates two string. This leads to the following:

        • split("", "#") = [""]
        • split("#", "#") = ["", ""]
        • split("##", "#") = ["", "" ,""]
        • split("123##456", "#") = ["123", "" ,"456"]
        • split("123##456", "##") = ["123", "456"]
        • split("#123#", "#") = ["", "123", ""]
        Parameters:
        string - A string to be splitted, not null.
        separator - A token separator, not null and not empty.
        Returns:
        The tokens contained in string, without separators.

      • split

        public static String[] split(String string,
                             char separator,
                             char escape)
        Splits a string which consists of zero or more parts concatenated with the given separator. Occurrences of the separator in the given string are assumed to be escaped with the given escape character. The escape character itself is also assumed to be escaped.
        Parameters:
        string - A string consisting of zero or more parts concatenated with the given separator.
        separator - A separator character.
        escape - An escape character.
        Returns:
        An array of unescaped parts of the given string.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If separator equals escape.
        NullPointerException - If strings is null.
